name: source_if
code:
condition = paste0("if(",if_condition,") { .branch = 'if_true' } else { .branch = 'if_false' }" )
print(paste0("if condition: ",condition)) #for bug checking

eval(parse(text=condition))
print(paste0(".branch: ", .branch)) #for bug checking
description: Node that evaluates a conditional statement and returns via the TRUE or FALSE branch. Data can also be made available to the node via the ifdata variable input.

variables.name: if_true
variables.description: Follows this path if condition is evaluated to TRUE

variables.name: if_condition
variables.description:
Condition to be evaluated within if statement in R code, e.g. "ifdata$var1 == ifdata$var2" or "ifdata == 10".

Note that in the condition you can refer to data that you're passing to the ifdata input variable. if you're using the data input as a list, then those list elements will be available from ifdata$whatever. If you're passing in just one number or string then it'll be ifdata.

variables.name: .branch
variables.description: Contains a character string based on the branch. Can be either "if_true" or "if_false"

variables.name: ifdata
variables.description: Data to be made available for the if statement

variables.name: if_false
variables.description: Follows this path if condition is evaluated to FALSE

params.label: Condition to be evaluated
params.description:
Condition to be evaluated within if statement in R code, e.g. "ifdata$var1 == ifdata$var2" or "ifdata == 10".

Note that in the condition you can refer to data that you're passing to the ifdata input variable. if you're using the data input as a list, then those list elements will be available from ifdata$whatever. If you're passing in just one number or string then it'll be ifdata.
params.name: if_condition
